required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 10, 2022
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Reader Study to Assess Accuracy and Reliability of Flortaucipir F 18 Positron Emission Tomography (PET) Scan Interpretation
clinical_study.official_title: A Reader Study to Assess Accuracy and Reliability of Flortaucipir F 18 PET Scan Interpretation

brief_summary.textblock: This study will evaluate the performance of physician readers trained to read flortaucipir-PET (positron emission tomography) scans.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Physician PET scan readers are participants, blinded to demographic and clinical data from the source PET scans.
study_design_info.masking_description: PET scans were obtained in an open-label fashion.

primary_outcome.measure: Primary Objective 1 Analysis 1: Diagnostic Performance of Individual Readers (NFT Score)
primary_outcome.description: Sensitivity and specificity of 5 independent readers' interpretations of ante-mortem 18F-AV-1451 PET imaging for detection of a pattern of 18F-AV-1451 neocortical uptake that corresponds to neurofibrillary tangles (NFT) Score of B3 (Hyman et al., 2012; Montine et al., 2012). NFT B scores range from B0 (no NFTs in the brain) to B3 (widespread NFTs in the brain). Sensitivity and specificity are percentages that can range from 0 to 100%. The hypothesis tested was that, of the 5 independent imaging physicians, at least 3 will have the lower bounds of 2-sided 95% CIs ≥50%, for both sensitivity and specificity.

primary_outcome.measure: Primary Objective 1 Analysis 2: Diagnostic Performance of Individual Readers (NIA-AA Autopsy Diagnosis)
primary_outcome.description: Sensitivity and specificity of 5 independent readers' interpretations of ante-mortem 18F-AV-1451 PET imaging for detection of a pattern of 18F-AV-1451 neocortical uptake that corresponds to high levels of AD neuropathologic change (High ADNC) as defined by National Institute on Aging-Alzheimer's Association (NIA-AA) criteria (see Hyman et al. 2012). ADNC categories are None, Low, Intermediate and High, with High indicating the most severe level of AD-related pathology changes in the brain. The hypothesis tested was that, of the 5 independent imaging physicians, at least 3 will have the lower bounds of 2-sided 95% CIs ≥50%, for both sensitivity and specificity.

primary_outcome.measure: Primary Objective 2: Inter-reader Reliability of Reader Interpretation of Flortaucipir-PET Imaging
primary_outcome.description: As measured by Fleiss' Kappa across all scans read. Fleiss' kappa is a statistical measure for assessing the reliability of agreement between a fixed number of raters when assigning categorical ratings to a number of items or classifying items. Fleiss' kappa can range from 0 to 1 with 1 indicating perfect agreement between the readers. Scan results binarized as positive AD pattern versus negative AD pattern. Results are displayed as percentage of agreement for individual reader pairs, computed as follows: number of images for which reader had the same interpretation divided by the total number of images evaluated, multiplied by 100%.

secondary_outcome.measure: Secondary Objective 1 Analysis 1: Diagnostic Performance of τAD++ Flortaucipir PET Images to Detect B3 NFTs
secondary_outcome.description: Flortaucipir F 18 PET imaging will be classified by each reader as either neocortical uptake not consistent with AD (τAD-), neocortical uptake consistent with AD (τAD+), or neocortical uptake consistent with AD with uptake beyond the temporal/occipital regions (τAD++). NFT scoring is according to Hyman, et al 2012. Truth positive is a NFT B3 score. Truth negative is NFT <B3 score.

secondary_outcome.measure: Secondary Objective 1 Analysis 2: Diagnostic Performance of τAD++ Flortaucipir PET Images to Detect High ADNC
secondary_outcome.description: Sensitivity and specificity of 5 independent readers' interpretations of ante-mortem 18F-AV-1451 PET imaging for detection of a pattern of 18F-AV-1451 neocortical uptake that corresponds to high levels of AD neuropathologic change (High ADNC) as defined by National Institute on Aging-Alzheimer's Association (NIA-AA) criteria (Hyman et al. 2012). Truth positive is a High ADNC score. Truth negative is No/Low/Intermediate ADNC score.

secondary_outcome.measure: Secondary Objective 2: Inter-reader Reliability of Reader Interpretation of τAD++ Flortaucipir PET Images
secondary_outcome.description: Overall reader agreement as measured by Fleiss' Kappa statistic. Scan results binarized as τAD++ versus τAD+/τAD-. Results are displayed as percentage of agreement for individual reader pairs, computed as follows: number of images for which reader had the same interpretation divided by the total number of images evaluated, multiplied by 100%.

secondary_outcome.measure: Secondary Objective 3: Inter-reader Reliability of Flortaucipir PET Scan Interpretation in the Population of Intended Use
secondary_outcome.description: Reader agreement measured by Fleiss' Kappa across scans from non-autopsy cases from Study A05. Scan results binarized as positive for AD pattern versus negative for AD pattern. Results are displayed as percentage of agreement for individual reader pairs, computed as follows: number of images for which reader had the same interpretation divided by the total number of images evaluated, multiplied by 100%.

secondary_outcome.measure: Secondary Objective 4: Intra-reader Reliability of Reader Interpretation of Flortaucipir-PET Imaging
secondary_outcome.description: Cohen's Kappa will be calculated for each of 5 readers to assess the intra-reader reliability of flortaucipir F 18 PET scan visual interpretation. The statistic takes into account the possibility of the agreement occurring by chance. Cohen's kappa values range from 0 to 1 with 1 representing perfect agreement. Results are displayed as percentage of agreement within a reader, computed as follows: number of images for which reader had the same interpretation at initial and second read divided by the total number of images evaluated twice by a reader, multiplied by 100%.

arm_group.description: Scans previously acquired from Study A16 (NCT02516046) and A05 (NCT02016560) will be read by independent, blinded readers.

intervention.description: No study drug will be administered.

criteria.textblock:
Scan Reader Criteria (5 total):
- Board-certified in radiology or nuclear medicine
- Professional experience interpreting PET scans
- Naive to study protocol
- No previous training or exposure to Avid Flortaucipir F 18 read methodology
Scan Criteria:
- Previous enrollment in Study A05 confirmatory cohort (NCT02016560), or A16 (NCT02516046)
Scan Study Population Criteria for FR01 (A05 confirmatory cohort):
- Cognitively-impaired
- mild cognitive impairment (MCI) or dementia with suspected neurodegenerative cause
- mini-mental status exam (MMSE) score of 20-27, inclusive
Scan Study Population Criteria for FR01 (Study A16):
- Subjects at end of life (less than or equal to 6 months)
- Imaged with flortaucipir F18 and came to autopsy

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Subjects were not recruited for this study. Study scans were selected from 2 previously completed imaging studies. Scans previously acquired from Study A16 (NCT02516046) and A05 (NCT02016560) were read by 5 independent, blinded to other study information.

group.title: All Autopsy Cases
group.description: Cases that had a valid scan and came to autopsy in in study A16 and the A16 supplemental cohort

group.title: Non-Autopsy Cases
group.description: Mild cognitive impairment (MCI) and AD cases from the A05 confirmatory cohort

group.title: All Cases
group.description: All eligible subject scans from contributing studies

measure.title: Age
measure.population: Baseline analysis includes Study A16 autopsy cases (n=83) and Study A05 Non-autopsy cases (n=159).

measure.title: Sex: Female, Male
measure.population: Baseline analysis includes Study A16 autopsy cases (n=83) and Study A05 Non-autopsy cases (n=159).

measure.title: Ethnicity (NIH/OMB)
measure.population: Measure Analysis Population Description: Baseline analysis includes Study A16 autopsy cases (n=83) and Study A05 Non-autopsy cases (n=159).

measure.title: Race (NIH/OMB)
measure.population: Measure Analysis Population Description: Baseline analysis includes Study A16 autopsy cases (n=83) and Study A05 Non-autopsy cases (n=159).

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander
Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Primary Objective 1 Analysis 1: Diagnostic Performance of Individual Readers (NFT Score)
outcome.description: Sensitivity and specificity of 5 independent readers' interpretations of ante-mortem 18F-AV-1451 PET imaging for detection of a pattern of 18F-AV-1451 neocortical uptake that corresponds to neurofibrillary tangles (NFT) Score of B3 (Hyman et al., 2012; Montine et al., 2012). NFT B scores range from B0 (no NFTs in the brain) to B3 (widespread NFTs in the brain). Sensitivity and specificity are percentages that can range from 0 to 100%. The hypothesis tested was that, of the 5 independent imaging physicians, at least 3 will have the lower bounds of 2-sided 95% CIs ≥50%, for both sensitivity and specificity.
outcome.population: Analysis included all autopsy subjects with an evaluable flortaucipir PET scan interpretation (n=82). One autopsy subject scan was rated as unevaluable. n=47 were truth positive for NFTs. n=35 were truth negative for NFTs.

group.title: Sensitivity of Flortaucipir vs Autopsy NFT Score
group.description: Subjects with a positive autopsy NFT score truth standard (NFT B3)

group.title: Specificity of Flortaucipir vs Autopsy NFT Score
group.description: Subjects with a negative autopsy NFT score truth standard (NFT B2 or lower)

measure.title: Primary Objective 1 Analysis 1: Diagnostic Performance of Individual Readers (NFT Score)
measure.description: Sensitivity and specificity of 5 independent readers' interpretations of ante-mortem 18F-AV-1451 PET imaging for detection of a pattern of 18F-AV-1451 neocortical uptake that corresponds to neurofibrillary tangles (NFT) Score of B3 (Hyman et al., 2012; Montine et al., 2012). NFT B scores range from B0 (no NFTs in the brain) to B3 (widespread NFTs in the brain). Sensitivity and specificity are percentages that can range from 0 to 100%. The hypothesis tested was that, of the 5 independent imaging physicians, at least 3 will have the lower bounds of 2-sided 95% CIs ≥50%, for both sensitivity and specificity.
measure.population: Analysis included all autopsy subjects with an evaluable flortaucipir PET scan interpretation (n=82). One autopsy subject scan was rated as unevaluable. n=47 were truth positive for NFTs. n=35 were truth negative for NFTs.

outcome.title: Primary Objective 1 Analysis 2: Diagnostic Performance of Individual Readers (NIA-AA Autopsy Diagnosis)
outcome.description: Sensitivity and specificity of 5 independent readers' interpretations of ante-mortem 18F-AV-1451 PET imaging for detection of a pattern of 18F-AV-1451 neocortical uptake that corresponds to high levels of AD neuropathologic change (High ADNC) as defined by National Institute on Aging-Alzheimer's Association (NIA-AA) criteria (see Hyman et al. 2012). ADNC categories are None, Low, Intermediate and High, with High indicating the most severe level of AD-related pathology changes in the brain. The hypothesis tested was that, of the 5 independent imaging physicians, at least 3 will have the lower bounds of 2-sided 95% CIs ≥50%, for both sensitivity and specificity.
outcome.population: Analysis included all autopsy subjects with an evaluable flortaucipir PET scan interpretation (n=82). One autopsy subject scan was rated as unevaluable. n=41 were truth positive. n=41 were truth negative.

group.title: Sensitivity of Flortaucipir vs NIA-AA Autopsy Diagnosis
group.description: Subjects with a positive truth standard (High ADNC)

group.title: Specificity of Flortaucipir vs NIA-AA Autopsy Diagnosis
group.description: Subjects with a negative truth standard (No/Low/Intermediate ADNC)

measure.title: Primary Objective 1 Analysis 2: Diagnostic Performance of Individual Readers (NIA-AA Autopsy Diagnosis)
measure.description: Sensitivity and specificity of 5 independent readers' interpretations of ante-mortem 18F-AV-1451 PET imaging for detection of a pattern of 18F-AV-1451 neocortical uptake that corresponds to high levels of AD neuropathologic change (High ADNC) as defined by National Institute on Aging-Alzheimer's Association (NIA-AA) criteria (see Hyman et al. 2012). ADNC categories are None, Low, Intermediate and High, with High indicating the most severe level of AD-related pathology changes in the brain. The hypothesis tested was that, of the 5 independent imaging physicians, at least 3 will have the lower bounds of 2-sided 95% CIs ≥50%, for both sensitivity and specificity.
measure.population: Analysis included all autopsy subjects with an evaluable flortaucipir PET scan interpretation (n=82). One autopsy subject scan was rated as unevaluable. n=41 were truth positive. n=41 were truth negative.

outcome.title: Primary Objective 2: Inter-reader Reliability of Reader Interpretation of Flortaucipir-PET Imaging
outcome.description: As measured by Fleiss' Kappa across all scans read. Fleiss' kappa is a statistical measure for assessing the reliability of agreement between a fixed number of raters when assigning categorical ratings to a number of items or classifying items. Fleiss' kappa can range from 0 to 1 with 1 indicating perfect agreement between the readers. Scan results binarized as positive AD pattern versus negative AD pattern. Results are displayed as percentage of agreement for individual reader pairs, computed as follows: number of images for which reader had the same interpretation divided by the total number of images evaluated, multiplied by 100%.
outcome.population: Analysis included all subjects who had a valid flortaucipir PET scan in the autopsy and non-autopsy groups (n=241)

measure.title: Primary Objective 2: Inter-reader Reliability of Reader Interpretation of Flortaucipir-PET Imaging
measure.description: As measured by Fleiss' Kappa across all scans read. Fleiss' kappa is a statistical measure for assessing the reliability of agreement between a fixed number of raters when assigning categorical ratings to a number of items or classifying items. Fleiss' kappa can range from 0 to 1 with 1 indicating perfect agreement between the readers. Scan results binarized as positive AD pattern versus negative AD pattern. Results are displayed as percentage of agreement for individual reader pairs, computed as follows: number of images for which reader had the same interpretation divided by the total number of images evaluated, multiplied by 100%.
measure.population: Analysis included all subjects who had a valid flortaucipir PET scan in the autopsy and non-autopsy groups (n=241)

analysis.groups_desc: Fleiss' kappa is a statistical measure for assessing the reliability of agreement between a fixed number of raters when assigning categorical ratings to a number of items or classifying items. The primary hypothesis to be tested was that the lower bound of two-sided 95% confidence interval of Fleiss' Kappa will be greater than or equal to 0.6.

outcome.title: Secondary Objective 1 Analysis 1: Diagnostic Performance of τAD++ Flortaucipir PET Images to Detect B3 NFTs
outcome.description: Flortaucipir F 18 PET imaging will be classified by each reader as either neocortical uptake not consistent with AD (τAD-), neocortical uptake consistent with AD (τAD+), or neocortical uptake consistent with AD with uptake beyond the temporal/occipital regions (τAD++). NFT scoring is according to Hyman, et al 2012. Truth positive is a NFT B3 score. Truth negative is NFT <B3 score.
outcome.population: Analysis included all autopsy subjects with an evaluable flortaucipir PET scan interpretation (n=82). One autopsy subject scan was rated as unevaluable. n=47 were truth positive for NFTs. n=35 were truth negative for NFTs.

group.title: Sensitivity of Flortaucipir tAD++ vs Autopsy NFT Score

group.title: Specificity of Flortaucipir tAD++ vs Autopsy NFT Score
group.description: Subjects with a negative autopsy NFT score truth standard (NFT B2 or lower)

measure.description: Flortaucipir F 18 PET imaging will be classified by each reader as either neocortical uptake not consistent with AD (τAD-), neocortical uptake consistent with AD (τAD+), or neocortical uptake consistent with AD with uptake beyond the temporal/occipital regions (τAD++). NFT scoring is according to Hyman, et al 2012. Truth positive is a NFT B3 score. Truth negative is NFT <B3 score.
measure.population: Analysis included all autopsy subjects with an evaluable flortaucipir PET scan interpretation (n=82). One autopsy subject scan was rated as unevaluable. n=47 were truth positive for NFTs. n=35 were truth negative for NFTs.

outcome.description: Sensitivity and specificity of 5 independent readers' interpretations of ante-mortem 18F-AV-1451 PET imaging for detection of a pattern of 18F-AV-1451 neocortical uptake that corresponds to high levels of AD neuropathologic change (High ADNC) as defined by National Institute on Aging-Alzheimer's Association (NIA-AA) criteria (Hyman et al. 2012). Truth positive is a High ADNC score. Truth negative is No/Low/Intermediate ADNC score.
outcome.population: Analysis included all autopsy subjects with an evaluable flortaucipir PET scan interpretation (n=82). One autopsy subject scan was rated as unevaluable. n=41 were truth positive. n=41 were truth negative.

group.title: Sensitivity
group.description: Sensitivity individual Flortaucipir PET scan interpreted as τAD++ pattern versus NIA-AA autopsy Diagnosis Truth Standard

group.title: Specificity
group.description: Specificity individual Flortaucipir PET scan interpreted as τAD++ pattern versus NIA-AA autopsy Diagnosis Truth Standard

measure.description: Sensitivity and specificity of 5 independent readers' interpretations of ante-mortem 18F-AV-1451 PET imaging for detection of a pattern of 18F-AV-1451 neocortical uptake that corresponds to high levels of AD neuropathologic change (High ADNC) as defined by National Institute on Aging-Alzheimer's Association (NIA-AA) criteria (Hyman et al. 2012). Truth positive is a High ADNC score. Truth negative is No/Low/Intermediate ADNC score.
measure.population: Analysis included all autopsy subjects with an evaluable flortaucipir PET scan interpretation (n=82). One autopsy subject scan was rated as unevaluable. n=41 were truth positive. n=41 were truth negative.

outcome.title: Secondary Objective 2: Inter-reader Reliability of Reader Interpretation of τAD++ Flortaucipir PET Images
outcome.description: Overall reader agreement as measured by Fleiss' Kappa statistic. Scan results binarized as τAD++ versus τAD+/τAD-. Results are displayed as percentage of agreement for individual reader pairs, computed as follows: number of images for which reader had the same interpretation divided by the total number of images evaluated, multiplied by 100%.
outcome.population: Analysis included all subjects who had a valid flortaucipir PET scan in the autopsy and non-autopsy groups (n=241)

measure.title: Secondary Objective 2: Inter-reader Reliability of Reader Interpretation of τAD++ Flortaucipir PET Images
measure.description: Overall reader agreement as measured by Fleiss' Kappa statistic. Scan results binarized as τAD++ versus τAD+/τAD-. Results are displayed as percentage of agreement for individual reader pairs, computed as follows: number of images for which reader had the same interpretation divided by the total number of images evaluated, multiplied by 100%.
measure.population: Analysis included all subjects who had a valid flortaucipir PET scan in the autopsy and non-autopsy groups (n=241)

analysis.groups_desc: Fleiss' kappa is a statistical measure for assessing the reliability of agreement between a fixed number of raters when assigning categorical ratings to a number of items or classifying items. The primary hypothesis to be tested was that the lower bound of two-sided 95% confidence interval of Fleiss' Kappa will be greater than or equal to 0.6.

outcome.title: Secondary Objective 3: Inter-reader Reliability of Flortaucipir PET Scan Interpretation in the Population of Intended Use
outcome.description: Reader agreement measured by Fleiss' Kappa across scans from non-autopsy cases from Study A05. Scan results binarized as positive for AD pattern versus negative for AD pattern. Results are displayed as percentage of agreement for individual reader pairs, computed as follows: number of images for which reader had the same interpretation divided by the total number of images evaluated, multiplied by 100%.

group.title: A05 Cases
group.description: All non-autopsy cases from the Study A05 population of intended use

measure.title: Secondary Objective 3: Inter-reader Reliability of Flortaucipir PET Scan Interpretation in the Population of Intended Use
measure.description: Reader agreement measured by Fleiss' Kappa across scans from non-autopsy cases from Study A05. Scan results binarized as positive for AD pattern versus negative for AD pattern. Results are displayed as percentage of agreement for individual reader pairs, computed as follows: number of images for which reader had the same interpretation divided by the total number of images evaluated, multiplied by 100%.

analysis.groups_desc: Fleiss' kappa is a statistical measure for assessing the reliability of agreement between a fixed number of raters when assigning categorical ratings to a number of items or classifying items. The hypothesis to be tested was that the lower bound of two-sided 95% confidence interval of Fleiss' Kappa will be greater than or equal to 0.6.

outcome.title: Secondary Objective 4: Intra-reader Reliability of Reader Interpretation of Flortaucipir-PET Imaging
outcome.description: Cohen's Kappa will be calculated for each of 5 readers to assess the intra-reader reliability of flortaucipir F 18 PET scan visual interpretation. The statistic takes into account the possibility of the agreement occurring by chance. Cohen's kappa values range from 0 to 1 with 1 representing perfect agreement. Results are displayed as percentage of agreement within a reader, computed as follows: number of images for which reader had the same interpretation at initial and second read divided by the total number of images evaluated twice by a reader, multiplied by 100%.
outcome.population: 20 scans read twice to assess the intra-reader reliability

group.title: Randomly Selected Re-reads
group.description: Cases randomly selected to be read twice by the same reader

measure.title: Secondary Objective 4: Intra-reader Reliability of Reader Interpretation of Flortaucipir-PET Imaging
measure.description: Cohen's Kappa will be calculated for each of 5 readers to assess the intra-reader reliability of flortaucipir F 18 PET scan visual interpretation. The statistic takes into account the possibility of the agreement occurring by chance. Cohen's kappa values range from 0 to 1 with 1 representing perfect agreement. Results are displayed as percentage of agreement within a reader, computed as follows: number of images for which reader had the same interpretation at initial and second read divided by the total number of images evaluated twice by a reader, multiplied by 100%.
measure.population: 20 scans read twice to assess the intra-reader reliability

reported_events.time_frame: Not applicable. Adverse events were not assessed during this study.
reported_events.desc: Adverse events were not assessed during this study.

group.title: All Cases
group.description: No study drug will be administered. Scans previously acquired from Study A16 (NCT02516046) and A05 (NCT02016560) will be read by independent, blinded readers.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
